name: General Trajectory
headline: Physical AI for industrial robots.
description:
General Trajectory is building AI for the physical world.

We are training vision-language-action (VLA) models across different embodiments to automate tasks such as palletization, sorting, picking, and packing.

founders.name: Joshua Belofsky, Founder
founders.description: Recent graduate focusing on general AI for industrial robots. Background is in academic ML research.

raw_markdown="[General Trajectory](https://www.generaltrajectory.com/</>)
[Home](https://www.generaltrajectory.com/</>)[Waitlist](https://www.generaltrajectory.com/</waitlist>)Contact
# General-purpose AI for industrial robots.
After AI automates computer work, the next bottleneck is the physical world. We're training general policies that can automate economically valuable work in the real world.
[Join the Waitlist](https://www.generaltrajectory.com/</waitlist>)
Backed By[![Y Combinator](https://www.generaltrajectory.com/ycombinator-logo.png)](https://www.generaltrajectory.com/<https:/www.ycombinator.com>)
## What We Do
**General Trajectory** is building AI for the physical world. We believe that physical AI can create a future with an abundance of goods and services for all of humanity.
We are starting with industrial tasks like palletization, sorting, and picking using mobile manipulators.
![Boston Dynamics](https://www.generaltrajectory.com/bostondynamics.png)
Credit to Boston Dynamics
## Research
A vision-language-action model (VLA) breaks down a high-level goal into an executable sequence of steps. Communication with the robot and its integration is no different than any other AI system—you just tell it what you want it to do in English. We are training highly capable VLAs across different embodiments for a variety of economically-valuable tasks.
As simulators improve, so does the quality of the synthetic data we are able to collect. This presents a promising avenue for increasingly capable models without traditional data bottlenecks.
Credit to Nvidia Research
### Ready to Automate Your Work Environment?
Let’s collaborate to bring AI into the real world.
[Join the Waitlist](https://www.generaltrajectory.com/</waitlist>)
General Trajectory — Building AI for the Physical World

generated_description:
**General Trajectory: Pioneering Physical AI for Industrial Robots**

Founded in 2024, General Trajectory is on a mission to revolutionize the physical world through the development of cutting-edge AI technologies for industrial robots. Located in the heart of San Francisco and recognized as part of Y Combinator Batch W25, this startup is focused on addressing the next big challenge in automation: bridging the gap between digital intelligence and the physical tasks that keep industries moving.

At the core of their operations, General Trajectory is training innovative vision-language-action (VLA) models. These models empower robots to perform essential tasks such as palletization, sorting, picking, and packing—areas where human-like dexterity is crucial. By employing mobile manipulators, they aim to streamline operations and enhance efficiency in supply chains, ultimately creating a future filled with an abundance of goods and services for everyone.

Their approach is particularly interesting because they have devised a system where users can communicate their objectives in plain English, making it easier to integrate sophisticated AI into real-world applications. The team at General Trajectory believes that as simulation technologies advance, they can gather increasingly accurate synthetic data, opening up opportunities for more powerful models without the traditional bottlenecks faced in data collection.

Currently, the company operates with a lean team of one employee and is ambitiously gearing up to tackle fundamental industrial challenges. With Harj Taggar as their Group Partner, they’re positioned to benefit from valuable mentorship and networking opportunities that come with being part of the Y Combinator ecosystem.

If you’re interested in seeing how AI can transform your work environment, General Trajectory invites you to join their waitlist. They believe that harnessing physical AI is not just about improving current processes—it’s about defining the future of how we work and live. For more information, you can check out their website [here](https://www.generaltrajectory.com/). 

In a nutshell, General Trajectory is at the forefront of melding AI with robotics, and they’re here to make a significant impact in the industrial sector. If they’re successful, we might just see a world where the heavy lifting—both literally and metaphorically—is handled by intelligent machines.
